body_html:
Maybe this will work:
add init op(like tf.global_variables_initializer) to the original graph, and in the second graph import the original one and get this init op with graph.get_operation_by_name and run the op with sess.run(init),
after this you can get any tensor with graph.get_tensor_by_name and run it out.
body_text:
Maybe this will work:
add init op(like tf.global_variables_initializer) to the original graph, and in the second graph import the original one and get this init op with graph.get_operation_by_name and run the op with sess.run(init),
after this you can get any tensor with graph.get_tensor_by_name and run it out.
body:
Maybe this will work:
add `init` op(like `tf.global_variables_initializer`) to the original graph, and in the second graph import the original one and get this `init` op with `graph.get_operation_by_name` and run the op with `sess.run(init)`,
after this you can get any tensor with `graph.get_tensor_by_name` and run it out.
